title: Kinetic theory - temperature and rms speed

content.question: The root-mean-square speed of the atoms of a monatomic ideal gas at a temperature of <math alttext="200 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math> is <math alttext="v sub root mean square" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>rms</mtext></msub></math>. At a later time, the root-mean-square speed of the atoms is <math alttext="2 v sub root mean square" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>rms</mi></msub></math>. What is the temperature of the gas at this later time?

choices.label: <math alttext="800 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>800</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>
<math alttext="400 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>400</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>
<math alttext="200 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>
<math alttext="50 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="800 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>800</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
